Title: Tonto NF Ground Trash Pickup
Description: The U.S. Forest Service, Tonto National Forest, Cave Creek Ranger District, intends to issue a contract for ground trash pickup and light maintenance services at eight (8) designated recreation sites within the Bartlett Lake and Needle Rock Recreation Areas, Maricopa County, Arizona. The Contractor shall furnish all labor, equipment, materials, tools, and transportation necessary to perform trash collection, micro-trash removal, pressure washing, and light maintenance in accordance with the attached Statement of Work (Attachment 1). Period of Performance: Base Year from September 30, 2025 – September 29, 2026, with four (4) one-year option periods. Service Schedule: Varies by season (Peak Season April–October; Off Season November–March). Specific site requirements and frequencies are provided in Attachment 1 – Statement of Work, along with maps of the service areas. Title: Request for quote Duress annunciator (Vindicator Equipment)
Description: Request for quote Duress annunciator (Vindicator Equipment) This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in FAR subpart 12.6 as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This solicitation is being conducted under Simplified Acquisition Procedures (SAP) as a Request for Quote (RFQ) No. FA850125Q0071 . This solicitation will be solicited under 100% small business set-aside. The Government is posting this combined synopsis/solicitation to identify potential sources who can provide and in and install duress annunciator (Vindicator Equipment) utilizing a Vindicator certified installer. They will install two silent duress’s located at Base Defense Operation Center (BDOC), one for each desk. The duress annunciator (Vindicator Equipment) will need to be installed at a twenty-four-hour manned Installation Access Control Point (IACP) Bldg. 217 (Watson Gate). The silent duress from BDOC shall also have a flashing light indicating duress. All associated equipment installed at Bldg. 217 shall be inside interior distribution boxes. Contractor is also responsible for all the programming that will be needed to accomplish this project. The main annunciator being used MUST be Vindicator. The contractor will be responsible for full installation, programming and the integration configuring testing and commissioning of the Vindicator system ensuring seamless operation with the existing infrastructure. This requirement is specifically restricted to the vindicator Brand. Vindicator is a brand of Honeywell who is the manufacture. The offer must include in their quote a description on how they will fulfill both the equipment and installation requirements, including but not limited to qualifications and experience with Vindicator systems. And if they have a Honeywell Vindicator certified installer, whom must be present during installation, programming, and testing prior to government acceptance. The government will evaluate these responses to determine technical acceptability and suitability for award. Also the installation of a Duress annunciator (Vindicator Equipment) will require utilizing a Vindicator certified installer, secondly the designed install to meet must meet applicable security regulatory guidance that includes the most current versions of the Non-Nuclear Configuration Management Database (CMD). The following instructions MUST be adhered to: Department of Air Force 31-101, Department of Air Force 31-101 DAFGM2022-01 GENADMIN, ESE-TP-0023 and related standards.

Description: This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial services prepared in accordance with (IAW) the format in FAR Subpart 12.6 and FAR Part 13, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. The following solicitation document, incorporated provisions, and clauses are in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular FAC 2025-05 Effective 7 August 2025. This acquisition is being conducted under Other than Full and Open Competition and is classified under the North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code 516210, Media Streaming Distribution Services, Social Networks, and Other Media Networks and Content Providers, with a size standard of $47.M. All prospective offerors must be registered in the System for Award Management (SAM) at www.sam.gov. Lack of SAM registration will make an offeror ineligible for award. Description of the Requirement: The mission of Department of Defense (DoD) Morale, Welfare, and Recreation (MWR) Libraries is outlined in DoDI 1015.10 stating DoD Libraries (DoDL) shall provide information resources and services required to accomplish the mission. The libraries support military personnel assigned to contingency operations, remote sites, and military missions IAW DoDI 1015.10, Military Morale, Welfare, and Recreation Programs. The program provides professional military and voluntary education program materials and services. Libraries also provide facilities, resources, and services to enhance the quality of life, regeneration, and resiliency for authorized customers. The DoD Library Consortium exists to create partnerships among the libraries within the various services of the DoD. They cooperatively acquire materials that are made available to military and civilian employees across the DoD. These resources relate to various overarching goals of the DoD such as recreation, physical wellness, emotional resiliency, and educational pursuits. To meet these needs, the 773d Enterprise Sourcing Squadron is seeking a trade skills education subscription. The Department of the Air Force Libraries (DAFL) requires an online resource that shall expand education in trade skills. The online resource subscription needs an effective and scalable learning resource with three-dimensional (3D) and virtual reality (VR) simulation content as part of the resources. The trade courses include construction, electrical, heating/ventilation/air conditioning (HVAC), plumbing, safety, solar, and other similar trades. Product Characteristics: (Vendors shall indicate ability to meet each item in their quotation) Shall provide a product which includes trade courses in HVAC, Solar, Electrical, Plumbing, Construction, Safety, Commercial HVAC and Appliance Repair. Shall be able to provide All-access via PC, iPad/Android tablet, and Virtual Reality (VR headset not required for simulations. Shall provide custom learning paths for all subjects. Shall provide unique dual delivery through a variety of technological devices. Shall provide a scaffolding approach to simulations and comprehensive content areas to support the skilled trades curriculum. Shall provide Technical Services including SSO and VR Setup Application; additional integrations can be scoped during contracts as needed. Assigned Customer Success Manager shall be provided for annual support including program mapping, training support, updates & product announcements Shall dedicate customer service representatives to resolve all service issues. Shall be able to interface with all 4-service branch library and Military OneSource websites using industry standard authentication methods to ensure only eligible patrons can access resources from any internet connected computer browsers and mobile devices. Shall work with the contract point of contact to establish authentication methods to provide optimal accessibility for all eligible patrons. Security between the Website and server shall be Transport Layer Security (TLS) 1.3. Shall be able to supply or allow retrieval of database usage statistics by Branch of Service (Air Force, Space Force, Army, Marine Corps, Military OneSource/Other, and Navy). Shall have HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) with long duration deployed on the servers to mitigate/prevent man-in-the-middle attacks. Website certificates should be RSA 2048-bits (SHA256withRSA). Shall have the ability to test the platform to evaluate if it meets requirements. Shall provide username and password to view content on platform. Period of Performance (PoP): The Period of Performance (POP) is for one (1) 12-month base period of performance and two (2) 12-month option periods. The period of performance for this contract action shall not exceed 12 months per base period and 12 months per option period. List of Attachments: 1. Pricing Schedule, 28 August 2025 2.
